com.risk.business

Interface IManageMap

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ManageMap

    public interface IManageMap
    This interface is responsible for handling all Map related functionalities like : Translating GUI Map into a File Map which can be parsed and stored in a Map File. Translating File Map into a GUI Map which can be rendered on UI. Map related validations like duplicate territories or continents and checking discontinuities in the map.
    Version:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    ApoorvSemwal

    • Method Detail

      • getFullMap

        Map getFullMap(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method is an abstraction for the process of retrieving A Map Object from the Map File to be saved/loaded.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Fully Qualified Map File Name on local disk. This file will be rendered for Playing as well as for Editing Map.
        Returns:
        Entire Map Object which will be rendered for Playing.

      • checkDuplicateTerritory

        java.lang.String checkDuplicateTerritory(Map map)
        This method checks the World Map Object for any duplicate territories.
        Parameters:
        map - Object Representation of the Map File.
        Returns:
        Any Errors if they exist otherwise empty String.

      • checkDiscontinuity

        java.lang.String checkDiscontinuity(Map map)
        This method checks the World Map Object for any discontinuities, i.e. any part(territories/set of territories) that are disconnected from the rest of the connected map.
        Parameters:
        map - Object Representation of the Map File.
        Returns:
        Any Errors if they exist otherwise empty String.

      • checkInvalidNeighbour

        java.lang.String checkInvalidNeighbour(Map map)
        This method checks the World Map Object for any territory being used as a neighbor, without actually being in existance.
        Parameters:
        map - Object Representation of the Map File.
        Returns:
        Any Errors if they exist otherwise empty String.

      • saveMap

        Map saveMap(Map map,
            java.lang.String file_name)
     throws java.lang.Exception
        This method receives the World Map Object from GUI and checks it for any discontinuities. If its valid then the map is converted to a FILE Object and forwarded to File Access Layer for saving to a physical MAP File. If its invalid then a boolean value False is returned to GUI.
        Parameters:
        map - GUI Object Representation of the World Map.
        file_name - Name of the Map file to be stored in Resource Folder.
        Returns:
        GUI Map otherwise with a status update for valid or invalid save.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - input/output exception

      • fetchMap

        Map fetchMap(java.lang.String file_name)
        This method retrieves an existing World Map File from Resource Folder and returns a MAP Object that can be rendered to UI. If the loaded file is an invalid Map then it returns Null.
        Parameters:
        file_name - Name of the Map file to be stored in Resource Folder.
        Returns:
        GUI Map object if its a valid map otherwise Null.

      • fetchMaps

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> fetchMaps()
        This method retrieves a list of existing World Map File from Resource Folder. User then selects a file from the given list.
        Returns:
        List of existing World Map Files from Resource Folder.

      • convertFileToMap

        Map convertFileToMap(File file)
        This method parses the File Object and converts it to a Map Object.
        Parameters:
        file - File Object Representing the Map File to be saved/loaded.
        Returns:
        Map map : Object Representation of the Map File.
